items.title: ‘Rip and Replace’: The Tech Cold War Is Upending Wireless Carriers
items.abstract: As China and the United States jockey for tech primacy, wireless carriers in dozens of states are tearing out Chinese equipment. That has turned into a costly, difficult process.

items.title: Robin Guenther, Architect of Healthy Hospitals, Dies at 68
items.abstract: Supporting the use of nontoxic construction materials, she co-wrote the first guide to building green health care facilities and designed them to be less austere.

items.title: Mexico Investigates Migrant Deaths in Border City Fire as Homicide Case
items.abstract: The authorities identified eight suspects and said government workers and private security workers had done nothing to help migrants flee the blaze at a detention center in Ciudad Juárez.

items.title: Colin McCord, Who Helped Impose a Smoking Ban, Dies at 94
items.abstract: The indoors prohibition, in New York City, was just one public health accomplishment. His global efforts on behalf of woman and children saved countless lives.

items.title: Dancing With America Has Been a Curse for the Philippines
items.abstract: The news that the U.S. military is planning to expand its presence in the Philippines has been dizzying and wounding.
keywords: United States Defense and Military Forces
